headline.main: New Marijuana Studies Find No Adverse Effect

docs.abstract: Panel of experts at NY Acad of Sciences Conf on Chronic Cannabis Use, NYC, issues findings indicating drug has no apparent significant adverse effect on human body or brain or other functions (L)
docs.lead_paragraph: Several recent studies of chronic marijuana users, conducted independently in half a dozen countries, indicate that the drug has no apparent significant adverse effect on the human body or brain or on their functions.
docs.snippet: Several recent studies of chronic marijuana users, conducted independently in half a dozen countries, indicate that the drug has no apparent significant adverse effect on the human body or brain or on their functions.

headline.main: Hey, Mister! Wayne Marks First 50 Years

byline.original: By GRACE LICHTENSTEIN Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: CARSON CITY, Nev. A man sits on horseback by the draw of a stream in Jack's Valley, silhouetted against the snowcapped Sierra Nevadas, a gray Stetson on his head, a red bandanna around his neck, a rifle jutting out from under his saddle.
docs.snippet: CARSON CITY, Nev. A man sits on horseback by the draw of a stream in Jack's Valley, silhouetted against the snowcapped Sierra Nevadas, a gray Stetson on his head, a red bandanna around his neck, a rifle jutting out from under his saddle.
